alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 7:53PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River near Harlem affecting Blaine County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high once again this week. Expect minor flooding downstream from Fresno Reservoir Dam. For the Milk River...including Harlem...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River near Harlem. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Escape routes for livestock may be cut off. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM MDT Monday the stage was 19.1 feet. - Impacts from earlier flooding, including standing water in fields, will persist, but additional flooding will likely return for the mid to late week period. - Forecast...The river will remain around 19.0 feet this evening. It is then forecast to rise above flood stage Tuesday night to 22.8 feet Thursday evening. It is forecast to fall below flood stage early Sunday morning to around 20.0 feet by Monday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.8 feet on 03/15/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Milk River Harlem 21.0 19.1 Mon 6 pm MDT 20.4 22.0 22.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1100 AM MDT.
